column4:
America's economy continues to show unprecedented resiliency, shattering previous records and posting its best GDP growth since World War II.

Together, we are fighting to build back our nation and emerge from this pandemic stronger than ever.

https://t.co/atWbxSeSvv

Senate Democrats claim to hate the filibuster but just exploited it to block $500 billion in coronavirus relief for American small businesses and families. 

It's clear DC Democrats will use anything at their disposal for their political games.

https://t.co/fkkwkokNDF

Happy to be at Rudd Farms in Greensboro this afternoon with @USDA Under Secretary @BillAtUSDA and @NCAgriculture Commissioner Steve Troxler to discuss the coronavirus food program and support for our farmers who relentlessly feed our state each and every day. https://t.co/feQ3gPeQzS

Thank you Major General Michael Cederholm and Col. Mikel Huber for the hospitality. Semper Fi! https://t.co/EWayOxIHQn

Even "GOP apologist" Wolf Blitzer knows the truth: Nancy Pelosi continues to resist and delay coronavirus relief at the expense of America's families and small businesses.

https://t.co/5Noi0lRjc4

Today is #WorldMentalHealthDay. I pause to think of all the families - many who have suffered privately. I pray that one day the stigma & shame is no longer part of the conversation. America is bouncing back: New unemployment claims continue to drop, falling to their lowest point since last March.

With 9.3. million jobs added over the past three months, our nation is showcasing its resiliency as we push through this pandemic together.
https://t.co/vayC43gaSN

https://t.co/1RLNGBwM8J

When three graduates were unable to walk across the commencement stage due to the pandemic, they decided to bike across the state for charity.

Over the course of 700 miles, they raised money for a Chapel Hill non-profit that helps feed the hungry.

https://t.co/kOIg5UISFt

Charitable giving is a valuable way for all North Carolinians to pull together and push forward through this pandemic.
